text: Yuriko Koike (born 15 July 1952) is a Japanese politician and the current governor of Tokyo.Yuriko Koike elected governor of Tokyo first woman in post She was born and raised in Ashiya, Hyōgo Prefecture. She dropped out of University in Japan, who moved to the Middle East and studied Arabic. She graduated from Cairo University in Egypt, and she began to work an interpreter and translator of Arabic. She worked as a journalist in the 1980s and entered politics in the 1990s. ==References== Category:1952 births Category:Living people Category:Politicians from Hyōgo Prefecture Category:Governors of Tokyo Category:Japanese translators Category:Defense ministers of Japan Category:Environment ministers of Japan
title: Yuriko Koike
